title.narrative: SAFE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By end-2020, the Government has capacity to assess preschools/schools for safety., which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Quality and Inclusive Early Learning:By end-2020, young children aged 3-8, including the most disadvantaged, benefit from preschool and primary education

sector.narrative: Climate change/environmental education, awareness and advocacy
Disaster risk reduction (including linkage to climate change)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end-2020, the Government has capacity to assess preschools/schools for safety.

description.narrative: In 2020 the in-service training course on Climate Change Adaptation was developed to strengthen quality of the on-going scaling up of the climate change environment and energy related formal curricula.; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:26/01/2021

title.narrative: Adaptation of inclusive DRR education materials into the national context and preparation for regional dissemination(48855)

target.value: 2020:Training materials on disability inclusive Climate Change, Environment & Energy are developed for caregivers to guide child-centered teaching nation-wide.

actual.value: 2020:Development of disability inclusive Climate Change, Environment & Energy materials was postponed due to COVID-19 pandemic restrictions.

title.narrative: Developement and piloting of school safety assessment methodology(47122)

target.value: 2020:200 additional schools and 100 kindergartens assessed with the school safety methodology (to achieve total of 780 schools and 310 kindergartens)

actual.value: 2020:While 110 kindergartens were assessed, the assessment of 200 secondary schools was postponed to 2021 due to the pandemic related restrictions and limitations. In the meantime, to strengthen capacity and coordination for, and further sustainability of the

title.narrative: Availability of updated curriculum taking into account climate- and environment- related risks and opportunities with focus on interactive teaching methods(52154)

baseline.value: The current curriculum includes issues related to climate change, environment and energy themes, but it is based on outdated information with limited space for interactive teaching

target.value: 2020:An in-service Climate Change Adaptation course is developed for schoolteachers. Documents on the ‘Green School' initiative are finalized with the MoE.

actual.value: 2020:An in-service Climate Change Adaptation course was developed to support quality interactive teaching and learning of CCEE curriculum by schoolteachers. ‘Green School’ documents were further adapted jointly with the MOE with their finalization planned for
